member.name: T:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamFactory
member.summary: Interface for factory for abstraction of System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlFileStream.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamFactory.GetSqlFileStream(System.String,System.Byte[],System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlFileStream class.
member.param: The logical path to the file. The path can be retrieved by using the Transact-SQL Pathname function on the underlying FILESTREAM column in the table.
The transaction context for the SqlFileStream object. Applications should return the byte array returned by calling the GET_FILESTREAM_TRANSACTION_CONTEXT method.

The access mode to use when opening the file. Supported System.IO.FileAccess enumeration values are System.IO.FileAccess.Read, System.IO.FileAccess.Write, and System.IO.FileAccess.ReadWrite. When using FileAccess.Read, the SqlFileStream object can be used to read all of the existing data. When using FileAccess.Write, SqlFileStream points to a zero byte file. Existing data will be overwritten when the object is closed and the transaction is committed. When using FileAccess.ReadWrite, the SqlFileStream points to a file which has all the existing data in it. The handle is positioned at the beginning of the file. You can use one of the System.IOSeek methods to move the handle position within the file to write or append new data.
member.returns: Returns a new SqlFileStreamWrapper

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamFactory.GetSqlFileStream(System.String,System.Byte[],System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileOptions,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlFileStream class.
member.param: The logical path to the file. The path can be retrieved by using the Transact-SQL Pathname function on the underlying FILESTREAM column in the table.
The transaction context for the SqlFileStream object. Applications should return the byte array returned by calling the GET_FILESTREAM_TRANSACTION_CONTEXT method.

The access mode to use when opening the file. Supported System.IO.FileAccess enumeration values are System.IO.FileAccess.Read, System.IO.FileAccess.Write, and System.IO.FileAccess.ReadWrite. When using FileAccess.Read, the SqlFileStream object can be used to read all of the existing data. When using FileAccess.Write, SqlFileStream points to a zero byte file. Existing data will be overwritten when the object is closed and the transaction is committed. When using FileAccess.ReadWrite, the SqlFileStream points to a file which has all the existing data in it. The handle is positioned at the beginning of the file. You can use one of the System.IOSeek methods to move the handle position within the file to write or append new data.

Specifies the option to use while opening the file. Supported System.IO.FileOptions values are System.IO.FileOptions.Asynchronous, System.IO.FileOptions.WriteThrough, System.IO.FileOptions.SequentialScan, and System.IO.FileOptions.RandomAccess.
The allocation size to use while creating a file. If set to 0, the default value is used.
member.returns: Returns a new SqlFileStreamWrapper

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation.
member.param: The buffer to read the data into.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data read from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the read is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests
member.returns: An System.IAsyncResult that represents the asynchronous read, which could still be pending.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.BeginWrite(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write operation.
member.param: The buffer to write data from.
The byte offset in buffer from which to begin writing.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the write is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous write request from other requests.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.EndRead(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read to complete.
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request to finish.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the stream, between zero (0) and the number of bytes you requested. Streams return zero (0) only at the end of the stream, otherwise, they should block until at least one byte is available.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous write operation.
member.param: A reference to the outstanding asynchronous I/O request.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an System.Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter
A value of type System.IO.SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.Data.Interfaces.ISqlFileStreamWrapper.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.System.Threading.CurrentThreadWrapper.Sleep(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Suspends the current thread for the specified number of milliseconds.
member.param: The amount of time for which the thread is suspended. If the value of the millisecondsTimeout argument is TimeSpan.Zero, the thread relinquishes the remainder of its time slice to any thread of equal priority that is ready to run. If there are no other threads of equal priority that are ready to run, execution of the current thread is not suspended.

member.name: M:Htec.Common.Abstractions.System.Threading.CurrentThreadWrapper.Sleep(System.Int32)

If there are no other threads of equal priority that are ready to run, execution of the current thread is not suspended.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Thread class, specifying the maximum stack size for the thread.
member.param: A ThreadStart delegate that represents the methods to be invoked when this thread begins executing.

The maximum stack size, in bytes, to be used by the thread, or 0 to use the default maximum stack size specified in the header for the executable. Important For partially trusted code, maxStackSize is ignored if it is greater than the default stack size.No exception is thrown.
